t: A song. A psalm of the Sons of Korah.
Great*pn is the Lord,*s and most worthy of praise, in*ld the city of our God, his holy mountain.
Beautiful*pn in its loftiness, the*ld joy of the whole earth, like*ln the heights of Zaphon is Mount Zion, the*ld city of the Great King.
God*ln is in her citadels; he*ld has shown himself to be her fortress.
When*pn the kings joined forces, when*ld they advanced together,
they*ln saw her and were astounded; they*ld fled in terror.
Trembling*ln seized them there, pain*ld like that of a woman in labor.
You*ln destroyed them like ships of Tarshish shattered*ld by an east wind.
As*pn we have heard, so*ld we have seen in*ln the city of the Lord*s Almighty, in*ld the city of our God: God*ln makes her secure forever.*ld
Within*pn your temple, O God, we*ld meditate on your unfailing love.
Like*ln your name, O God, your*ld praise reaches to the ends of the earth; your*ld right hand is filled with righteousness.
Mount*ln Zion rejoices, the*ld villages of Judah are glad because*ld of your judgments.
Walk*pn about Zion, go around her, count*ld her towers,
consider*ln well her ramparts, view*ld her citadels, that*ln you may tell of them to*ld the next generation.
For*pn this God is our God for ever and ever; he*ld will be our guide even to the end.
